feed.title: Justin Choi
feed.subtitle: Welcome to Justin Choi's Blog, a space dedicated to sharing insights, tutorials, and experiences in the world of software development. With over 14 years of experience in full-stack development, I delve into topics ranging from web development and cloud computing to machine learning and AI. Join me as I explore the latest trends, best practices, and innovative solutions in technology. Whether you're a seasoned developer or just starting out, there's something here for everyone looking to enhance their skills and knowledge in the tech industry.

entry.title: Financial Assets Management Web Application Project

link.title: Financial Assets Management Web Application Project

entry.summary:
1. Executive Summary
Asset-Dash is a finance web application designed to replace a Google Spreadsheet-based financial management system. The application will provide comprehensive financial tracking, including asset management, investment portfolio monitoring, credit card tracking, cashflow management, budget/spending management, and long-term financial planning.
It requires a robust, secure,...

entry.title: Effective Software Architecture (translation)
entry.summary:
Overview
This is a Korean translation of Oliver Goldman’s book on effective software architecture. The translation presents practical guidance for designing, evolving and governing software systems, covering context, change, process, design, decision-making, practices, communication, architecture teams, and product development organizations.

entry.title: Shells, Terminals, and More
entry.summary:
Introduction
In this post, we’ll explore the fascinating world of command-line interfaces, focusing on essential tools and concepts such as shells (Bash and Zsh) and terminal emulators (iTerm2). As developers and system administrators, these tools are crucial for efficiently interacting with our systems. We’ll dive into the reasons behind my personal choices and provide step-by-step guides on ...

entry.title: Malaria Detection using Machine Learning
entry.summary:
Technologies Python, TensorFlow, Keras, Scikit-learn
Description This project focused on developing machine learning models to classify parasitized and uninfected cells in the malaria dataset. The project was divided into three phases: data selection, model training, fine-tuning, and performance evaluation. Below is the final report that I wrote for the project.

entry.title: Banking Web Applications Project
entry.summary:
Description
Developed a comprehensive banking web application as a freelance project, integrating advanced features such as ultra-secure SSR authentication, multi-bank account linking using Plaid, and real-time updates across all pages. The application provides users with a detailed overview of their accounts, including total balances, recent transactions, and categorized spending. Users can v...
